result.execSummary:
The defendant Trey A Olds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant must obtain his GED.

Defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
Defendant must undergo anger management assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trey A Olds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Trey A Olds, in custody, in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 12:13 PM. State - here for SAR. Scholke no errors or inaccuracies. State - asks the court to ignore the compass section, court will not give any weight to it. State advises of court probation violations and asks for 120 days in FC jail on only count. Scholke makes statement and argues for time served and has 55 days credit (stipulated). Olds makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences to the following: Count 2 - 70 days in FC jail, good time allowed, apply 55 days credit. Right to appeal. Enter civil judgment for unpaid fines.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 31, 2016 at 11:15 am.
From defendant's attorney requesting furlough. Judge did not sign, as defendant is sitting on a P&P hold, judge has no authority to order.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Trey A Olds in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:12 PM. State - resolved. Scholke agrees - dismiss and read in count #1, plead G to count #2 as alleged, joint recommendation of 1 year probation with conditions of: anger management, restitution to victim, 50 hours of community service. State agrees, has complied with victim notification requirements with no request for restitution, victim is in the courtroom today (H.K.). Victim states name, not requesting any restitution and does not wish to make a statement. Olds agrees with agreement as stated. Court dismisses and reads in count #1. Olds pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Scholke - follow joint recommendation. Olds withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: costs (including DA surcharge) - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, submit DNA sample with expungement verbage, 50 hours of community service, anger management and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, obtain GED, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, right to appeal. Scholke asks for expungement upon successful completion of probation - credit for 5 days only if revoked. Clerk calculates one day credit. State has no objections to expungement. Court - will authorize expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant Trey A Olds in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:17 PM. State - here for AIA. Scholke has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Trey A Olds in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:32 AM. Olds has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Olds undersands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own, recess to talk to SPD (9:34 AM). Recalled at 9:56 AM. Olds states that Ms. Burns cannot represent him, does qualify for SPD. Court sets for AIA on 10/21/15 at 10:15 AM. State - bond - $150.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol. Court so orders.
